Sentence (Nigerian Pidgin): I go dey work from house next week.

Q: Who you go meet for office?
A: I go meet Madam Clara.

Q: Na where you dey go?
A: I dey go bank.

Q: Why you dey frown face?
A: Na because I lose my phone.

Q: When your exam dey?
A: Next week Wednesday.

Q: You sure say you lock door?
A: I lock am well.

Q: Who carry my slippers?
A: Check near bathroom.

Q: You sabi repair generator?
A: Small, I fit try.

Q: Di road clear?
A: E still block small.

Q: Wetin she tell you?
A: She say make I wait.

Q: You go fit finish am?
A: I go try my best.
